website_summaries.verdict: A lofty price tag can't keep parents from this tough, attractive walker that outpaces competitors in quality.
pros: Stands out for its stress-free cleanup and numerous adjustable height positions
cons: No interactive components, but the tray is spacious for babies' favorite toys

customer_reviews.title: I Love this walker
customer_reviews.text: I Love this walker!! I've been on a hunt for one for my son for sometime now and this one met my expectations, unfortunately I am on the tall side so my baby is pretty tall for his age he's only 7 months but he is 28 ins long and this doesn't go up high enough for him his feet are flat on the ground so sad I have to return, and now I am back on the hunt looking for a walker but just a heads up if your baby is 27 or longer I wouldn't buy it . It doesn't go up high enough 😢
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret the Joovy Spoon!!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously LOVE this joovy spoon. I looked at several different types of walkers and Excersaucers before purchasing. I chose the joovy because it grows with your child, has a removeabke tray for feeding/cleaning, lays flat for storage, AND then best part is toys can be changed out unlike so many other activity tables. Another huge bonus for me was the look of the joovy doesn't scream baby. We keep it out in our kitchen and our daughter has been using it since she was 4 months old! Will think about purchasing other Joovy products in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Howell

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy a different walker
customer_reviews.text: When my son started using this, we already had it at the second height setting. Now it’s at the third and he manages to crawl out of the walker because of the long front end. He has fallen out twice now. This isn’t safe and it isn’t designed to last long. I thought because of the price and reviews that it would work well for us. Now it’s past the return date for me. Please please please for NOT buy this walker!!!! Also, it doesn’t work well on carpet to floor. He gets stuck all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jelena

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, too short!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice color and design, but height adjustment does not have enough settings. My baby is 7 months and just at 29 inches tall. The highest height setting is already too short. His legs are bowed and he's crouched down trying to maneuver in this walker. We purchased the walker this week. Its features are great (wide tray with removable top, removable seat in monotone colors, solid construction), but it's not usable if your baby is anywhere near 30 inches tall. Unfortunately this purchase is a complete waste of money for us. The product is most likely suited for babies who are in the 70th or less percentile for height.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistency with height
customer_reviews.text: The quality and clean lines is there without all the bulk other walkers have but my issue is that my son is 8.5 months old, an average size baby and he toes are just barely able to reach now! It’s in the lowest setting and only goes higher which puts him airborne.. I’ve read other reviews saying the complete opposite where the baby is way too tall for it so there must be QA issues with it as far as height. It’s a bummer because we can’t return it any longer and still can’t use it. By the time we can he will be walking so now I’m finally giving in and buying another one
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite baby product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our now 8 month old. She was about 7 1/2 months when she first used it. It took a few days for her to get the hang of it but now she zips around the kitchen. We have a low pile carpet and she is able to navigate onto carpeted areas with a little more effort. We zip tied the foam back onto the bottom front corners to protect the baseboards a little bit. The wide base helps protect her fingers and deter her from opening drawers and cupboards. It’s obvious she appreciates the autonomy of navigating the house as she pleases.
customer_reviews.author: lyndsie

customer_reviews.title: Two Walkers with Deffective Height
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the Blueberry color on Prime Day and we decided to measure the height based on a previous reviewer. It was 3 inches shorter than what it’s suppose to be. 15inches on the highest setting vs. 18 inches. We exchanged it and measured the new one. Same issue! Amazon please stop selling the deffective walkers or return to manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: veronica owen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase! LOVE THIS WALKER
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews might make you uncertain about purchasing this. I hope you read mine- This walker is awesome! It’s proven to be safe, our daughter who does not like being strapped in to any seat, LOVES THIS. She’s 9 months old, we purchased when she had just turned 8 months-old, and she loves being in it more and more everyday! She cruises around and enjoys eating her puffs. The large tray is fantastic. If you have carpet I would not buy. But I’m not sure any walker is good on carpet 🤷🏼‍♀️ But it rolls wonderfully on the hard woods! She bumps into all of our new walls and cabinets and it hasn’t left a mark!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Too Short!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old is big and in the 90th percentile for height (28 inches) and weight but this walker says it can accommodate up to 33 inches but I do not believe that. This was wayyyy to short for my baby, she could lay her whole chest down on the tray and could bend over in half. This did not work for us so we returned it, just be careful purchasing this for larger babies....make sure you can return it if needed. The quality seemed great but the height was a problem!
customer_reviews.author: JHF

customer_reviews.title: The seat design is unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware! This is a huge safety concern, and I feel this product should be recalled. I purchased with the expectation that its #1 rating on Google search would hold true. Unfortunately the front of the seat kept separating from the frame despite proper installation. This is not worth $80 nor my daughter's safety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 month old to help him walk. First the product is very large/wide so if you have a smaller home or lots of furniture don’t buy it. It will not go on carpet. The tipping feature is good however the bars on it allow a child to put there foot on it and climb out and they could get hurt very badly. (I learned this the hard way) don’t leave the room for one second with a child in it because it is not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Suann l

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy, rolls well on our wood floor. Straight forward to assemble. Love the size of the table and that the frame design prevents tiny hands getting jammed or scratched when whizzing around the apartment and in-between doors. Our daughter took to it straight away around 5-6 months, although being in the higher percentile - my main criticism would be the limited height adjustment options. We started on the highest setting so had no further setting available whilst she grew, so a short life span / investment.
customer_reviews.author: British parent

customer_reviews.title: My child pulled himself out of the walker.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this walker for my son when he was 10 months old, and he absolutely loved it for a good 4 weeks. By 11 months, he managed to pull himself completely out of the walker by wrapping his hands around the tray. I didn't believe our babysitter at first but saw it for myself. He managed to pull himself all the way to the point where he was sitting up on the tray. This walker needs a seatbelt or something to keep babies contained. It is a huge safety hazard for mobile babies, and we had to put it away for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUETLY worth getting
customer_reviews.text: This walker is actually a walker. we tried a dino lights and whatever and that was just a seated activity center. This walker is absolutely worth the price. It's weight limit is 30lbs (my boy is big, he's already 25 lbs at 9 months. We expected a physical delay because of his size but it seemed like he didn't know where to start. He got in this walker and started pushing backwards. the next day he's going forwards and roaming the house. He usually glides but he is learning steps and standing (Also great that when he "falls over" he doesn't actually fall, he is protected and not getting hurt helps him try more often).
customer_reviews.author: Rox R

customer_reviews.title: came assembled incorrectly and cannot fix
customer_reviews.text: product didn’t come assembled properly and now it is unbalanced and not really useable will have to return, pretty disappointed. if i was able to fix myself i wouldn’t care but as you can see in the picture it is at the lowest setting and i cannot put it in place, i shouldn’t have to take the whole thing apart to fix their mistake
customer_reviews.author: Mark Chang

customer_reviews.title: Get this if there is any chance your baby will be tall so you don't pay double later down the road!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great walker for any baby, but *especially* if you have a tall baby, it's only a couple of inches taller than my first walker but also has greater stability and the top insert tray comes off easily for an adult to be able to clean and still have the bottom "real" tray to set baby's items on. As well the first walker we had did not move or turn as easily as this one. Warning, you DO need 2 hands to remove the tray but it makes cleaning easier after meals and it's harder to knock toys off if your baby loves the throw toys on the floor game.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Paeschke

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Work on the Carpet Floor
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving 3 stars because it does NOT work on the carpet floor. My apartment has carpeted living room and that’s where my son spends most of the time in the jumper while I’m cooking in the kitchen. I thought he is ready for a walker so I gave it Joovy for a try since the design, quality and usability was great on reviews. But one thing I didn’t really think about is carpeted floor. Since the walker has tiny wheels, it sinks in the carpet and do not move at all when I put my son. It looks great and I wish we had a floor... or if it has a bigger wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this walker I really wanted to love it. We ordered one first and the wheels were terrible. I returned that one and they sent me a replacement. I was so happy to see that the wheels functioned as they should. However now the wheels are stuck again. We tried everything for it to work but it will not move anywhere. Sending this one back and I am not getting a replacement this item is too expensive for this to happen twice. I gave it two stars because of the simplicity of building it and how modern and clean it looks besides that functionality is a Big NO
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Pomales

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it but
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old is bellow average height and when sitting in the walker it’s like most over body sticks out, as if her torso is too long (which it’s obviously not). When trying to stand she ends up falling foreword out of the seat because of how high up the seat is. The seat really needs some kind of adjustment where it sinks in more, to not only make it more comfortable for baby but so baby can easily fall out. Also I feel like the height adjustments is meant for extremely short babies. If you have a tall baby this wouldn’t last past 4 or 5 months
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Simple quality
customer_reviews.text: This walker is really nice. It is adjustable and easy to set up and stow away. The baby fits well, and really likes to boogie around in it; He is around 18lbs currently. The bottom of the walker is wide enough that it helps to protect their fingers if they are grabbing the edge as they walk and happen to walk against a vertical surface. It cleans up easy. The only thing I didnt like is that the front wheels are just plastic, if the rolling surface had some rubber on it this would have been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: WAY too short & pinches fingers.
customer_reviews.text: This walker is fantastic... except for the fact that it’s WAY WAY WAY too short, and it’s just big enough to allow her fingers to be pinched when she holds the sides. To be honest, our kid is on the taller end but even on the hugest setting is so much shorter than majority of walkers on the market. It’s so incredibly disappointing because the walker itself is great quality. I moves well and has tons of space for toys! Really disappointed that we can no longer use this and our kid is only 8 months old. Looks like we have to find another different brand that accommodates her height.
customer_reviews.author: yjdds

customer_reviews.title: Seat Fabric Came Apart First Week!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this walker FIVE times so far for my eight month old. I love the size of the tray and the height (even though other complained about it). My problem is with the fabric on the seat (see picture). After the first week of use the seam on the back of the seat started coming apart. We have never washed the seat so there is no reason for this to happen. I have contacted Joovy support and haven’t heard anything back. I don’t want to continue to use the product because if the seat comes apart more, my son could be hurt. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Becca D

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy - Recommend
customer_reviews.text: PROS So this is that ONE thing that you take out of a box and it’s basically put together. You have to snap on the front 2 wheels and place the seat in. Done! My 6 month old does well in the first position. One pull up literally. In order to fold there is an easy (for adults) twist on the bottom of the tray area. HUGE tray with removable insert. Great for eating and playing. CON The only con I have so far is that it would be nice if they added loops/hooks to attach toys to so they didn’t constantly hit the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great on carpet, nice design, a little too tall still for my baby
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4.5 month old. He’s 22” tall but can’t quite touch the floor flat footed yet. It stills makes for a great place to eat some purées, hangout in while I shower, or just to chill in. It pushes around easily on our carpeted floors and kitchen laminate. It folds down and surprisingly doesn’t take up as much space as I worried about. The plastic isn’t cheap looking, the seat is actually comfortably made, and the removeable tray makes cleanup super easy. It came put together, I just had to put on the wheels and snap the seat in. I can’t wait until he can start reaching the ground and walking around!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: I like the tray space and how easy it moves on carpet. However the back wheels only go straight and don’t turn so compare to other walkers with all wheels rotate this one is lacking a bit. This walker also doesn’t lock in place so if you have a baby who’s ‘walking’ already be careful with food on the tray as it could get messy around the house.
customer_reviews.author: FP

customer_reviews.title: Rear wheels don't swivel.  It matters!
customer_reviews.text: It's harder than it should be for baby to change direction because the rear wheels are fixed--they don't swivel as they should. I bought this walker because the tray is large and plain--and that's what I was looking for. Never entered my head that only two of the wheels would swivel. I can't think of a reason for designing it this way. If I had it to do over--I'd pay attention to that fact. Because of the fixed wheels, the walker is not as responsive to baby's sideways movement--it moves forward and backward easily--sideways--not so much
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF CUTENESS AND SORE TOES
customer_reviews.text: My son loves crashing into members of our household full force running over our toes. Needless to say—avoid this happening at all costs because you WILL be in pain. I have PTSD and run from it when I see him coming. ASIDE FROM THAT: We love this product. Him being able to follow us around and play is worth the battered toes. He is also adorable in it. Buy right away for your little one!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I love the simplicity, long tray, and removable tray insert. Baby can play with toys and is less likely to drop them while bashing them on the tray :) my baby likes to take toys and tap them on a surface in front of her and this is perfect for her reach. She’s 7 months and just scoots around lol. Love it! Easy setup for me. But I’m fairly good at figuring things out without instructions. Seat was a tiny bit difficult to secure but when it’s attached it’s IN there.
customer_reviews.author: buddie

customer_reviews.title: Simple and worth it for younger babies.
customer_reviews.text: This product is probably the 4th walker/bouncer I’ve tried out for my son. But this too like the others are too short for him on the highest setting. But off all the ones I got this is by far the best in every aspect. It’s sturdy, the seat seems more comfortable and the leg holes are much bigger than the rest (my son has chunky thighs). It’s very easy to change the height of the seat as well. The best feature of this walker I feel is the tray in front! It’s soo big and if I ended up keeping it I would have definitely given him some meals in the walker.
customer_reviews.author: PML

customer_reviews.title: Came unassembled. Returning
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the modern design. I took it out of the box and one of the legs is not assembled. There's no way to get it in the slot without taking things apart. After looking through other reviews this apparently has happened a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: It’s funny how this walker has stunning reviews because we did not enjoy it at all. We had a Chico & I thought that we should get her a better walker/more expensive.... I was so wrong. It’s way to big to fit through a door of a right corner. Not tall enough for her to grow into. The tray is SO big that she can’t reach any of the toys we put on the tray. The quality is so nice, but almost too nice.... it’s so heavy she can’t moce around like the Chico. Sounds crazy but save your money & get a Chico walker. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, quality walker.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this walker! Spacious tray, far better than anything I've seen in any of the retail stores, including BabiesRUs. Love that it doesn't have all the annoying added, "fixed" toys, so baby's entertainment can be kept interesting. Removable tray liner cleans nicely. The featured safety measures around the base are fantastic. The slightest drop would immobilize the walker. Clean, modern design is beautifully gender-neutral. The adjustable height is a huge plus, also. The footprint of this walker is slightly larger than average, but does not diminish its superiority, in my opinion. Absolutely worth the little extra investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about paying $90 for a walker, but after thinking on it for a couple of weeks, I’m thankful I decided to! This has a built in tray that pops out and is dishwasher safe, so it doubles as a high chair. It’s portability has made bringing it to family functions very nice! Super sturdy as well! I also have to say that, it’s a bit larger than other walkers I’ve used for my other children, BUTTTTT the tray being as large as it is prevents the baby from being able to grab things she shouldn’t have.🙃
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Quality Made and Safe
customer_reviews.text: This walker is amazing! We ordered it for our granddaughter and she loves it! She loves to sit and play with her toys. The tray is big and deep enough to keep her toys inside. The removable clear plastic cover on the tray is wonderful to keep things clean. The base is wide and low to the ground so there is no fear of tipping. The seatback is padded and has a wipeable surface, though I don't think it is easy to remove to clean. This piece of baby equipment checked all the boxes for us. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Parish

customer_reviews.title: Great walker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson. He loves it. It has a large tray with removable insert. It folds down easily and has about 3 different height settings. My grandson is about 27 inches tall but started using this when he was 24 inches tall. It has a wide base and does not topple over easily. We have had no problems with topping over so far. He uses this more than the saucer and it gives him the freedom he wants to move around. I have no regrets buying this and would buy it again if we ever need another.
customer_reviews.author: T.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great open baby walker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this walker, it’s easy to disassemble and clean. It folds up very simply for storage and transport. We absolutely love the the large open table on it. A lot of other strollers have toys permanently fixed to them. Our oldest son never really played with the ones that were on his. The large open table allows for toys our second son actually plays with, plus snacks or it’s easy to clear off and feed breakfast/lunch/supper. Rolls super easy, the guards prevent steep drops. Great for letting the little one wander the house in.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: literally the best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: This walker is amazing ! It does it all. Place for baby to eat, snack, play, walk and dance! The tray is large enough for all your baby’s messes. You can take out the tray to clean easily and also stores flat for storage and travel. I looked everywhere for a good product for all of these needs I’m just upset I didn’t get it sooner. I read some reviews that said it doesn’t glide well and I haven’t noticed that problem at all. If you have hardwood flooring and little rug your baby will be traveling in all areas of the house easily!
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Joovy Walker
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent walker. My granddaughter is walking now but it still keeps her in check against sudden falls or bumps on the head from tables or other corners. She loves to eat from the tray. The tray is nice and wide and keeps most of the food in place. Plus there's lots of room for play toys as well. It gives the mom some free relaxed time from holding or watching every second when she's walking. It's lots of fun movement for the baby and keeps her at a distance from things that are not for babies.
customer_reviews.author: RED

customer_reviews.title: Too short 🤷
customer_reviews.text: I love the joovey walker, my kid loves walking all over the house and he gives me some free time, however one thing I dislike greatly is the height. I got this when my baby was 7 months old and I used it at the highest setting 😐 my son is tall so yeah. My boy is now 10 months old and can get out of it 🤦 he just pulls himself out. Wish it had a higher setting . My kid is almost walking anyways but this walker didn't last that much for us. Other than what I mentioned it is great and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and awkward for my baby. Wasn't even able ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and awkward for my baby. Wasn't even able to use it. Closing it up is the biggest pain in the butt ever. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Baby pulls himself out
customer_reviews.text: We loved this walker for the first few days, till baby learned to pull himself out of it ( very scary). There is no way to stop the head injury if baby falloff of it. I called manufacturer and there is no useful suggestion beside keeping eye on him all the time. I used it for a petite 10 months old ( not standing or walking)
customer_reviews.author: Maloos

customer_reviews.title: The seat comes unhooked
customer_reviews.text: I don’t love that the inside of the seat detached from the walker itself. It doesn’t matter how many times it “clicks”, the seat will always come undone. I’d hate to see my baby fall through once she is on the go. I’m going to try and disassemble and return. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Riley

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall babies!  Nice product for shorter kids.  Returned promptly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my then 7 month old who was ready for it but the item is only for shorties apparently. It was way too short for him even on the highest setting. The product seems durable and easy to use but caveat emptor! Not for tall kids. It's also very bulky in width/depth. Returned the day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik B

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so nifty!
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker so far. We got it when bebe was 4 months to introduce putting weight on her feet. She fit it perfectly, with room to grow! The tray is a good size and has a removable section for easier clean up. Everything about how it folds up and adjusts is easy and intuitive to understand. You won't regret this purchase, but I'd buy it earlier than you think you may need it (before 6 months) so you can get a lot of use out of it. My baby is 50th percentile, so if you have a little chonk, he/she may not fit it for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Seems SO perfect, but is far too short.
customer_reviews.text: I'm kicking myself for not reading the reviews. Our baby boy, who is 10 months, wants to be mobile but is shaky on his feet. He is 30 inches and I just ordered him this as a safe option, so he isn't crawling or falling over, but can still move around. We didn't realize we had it on the highest setting and he is nearly able to crawl out. We will get a few weeks use out of it, but definitely would appreciate a taller setting for babies that still can't walk. Such a great concept, just need a few tweaks!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy Again!
customer_reviews.text: I would buy one again not that I need too ..unless we get surprised with twins .... We love this walker and we searched for a long time for the perfect walker. We wanted one that plain without a themepark attatched. This one is perfect. The tray removes for easy clean up and pushing it around is a breeze. Our floors are not the best but it just goes. It also collapses fairly flat and it looks soooo clean.
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It's the best baby purchase we made.
customer_reviews.text: TLDR: Buy it. The longer review: I've had this item for about 9 months now. My kid is probably slightly to tall for it but we still use it. We've used it as a highchair when we travel or kiddo is to antsy to sit still. We use it when outside but don't necessarily want hey crawling around. We've used it in the kitchen when we want her to be active but we need to cook or clean. It was pricey for a walker but I would by it a million more times - worth every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: browntown023

customer_reviews.title: This walker is very sturdy but it is huge and the tray is huge
customer_reviews.text: This walker is very sturdy but it is huge and the tray is huge. When my 7 month old tries to grab a toy he accidentally pushes it to the edge of the tray and he can't reach it. The wheels do not turn easily. It's difficult to for me to even push it around the island in my kitchen. I can see why it might be tough on a childs hips. It's a good place to put him when I need to be in the kitchen. But I think I'll look for a small one that's easier to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: These are fine, but no better than the much cheaper ones
customer_reviews.text: Ok product. Too expensive for what you get. Won't stay locked in any of the three adjustable positions. Will not roll with even the slightest transition between rooms or from solid floor to thin rug. These walkers are constantly getting stuck.These are fine, but no better than the much cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best walker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best walker I've seen. Our 8 month old was very apprehensive on day one, not liking it or moving in it, but at day three she has it mastered and is running all over the house. The living room and kitchen are separated by the hallway which is a tile higher (e.g. 1/4") and even this small change in surface is enough to prevent the walker moving forward. Very well designed and makes me feel assured that if the walker ever made its way up the staircase that there is no way our baby would be coming down :)
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but front wheel issues
customer_reviews.text: The product design is nice. Looks great and easy to raise and lower. The problem that I see is the front wheels. The entire unit seems well made, however the front wheels seem to be cheap plastic. When the baby tries to move, the front swivel wheels rarely align themselves in the direction that the baby is trying to go and the end up just sliding along the floor. It makes it more difficult for the baby to move since they have to slide the unit along rather than roll. I don't know what the solution is, but they may be better if they had some rubber of something that gives some friction.
customer_reviews.author: Sjn007

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price! Works great on carpet!
customer_reviews.text: We have carpet in our house (the type that home builders use, the normal kind, lol) and was looking for something our 8 month old at the time could use to get around easily. This did the trick! It took him some time to really move around on carpet and now you can’t stop him he’s now 11 months old. He loves it and so does Mama! Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lacroix

customer_reviews.title: Our munchkin loves this thing for walking!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby was definitely not a crawler but she loves walking in this! She went from barely knowing how to move a few steps to running around and blasting into our walls and cabinets :D I had to put some pipe insulation (soft foam) around the walker to stop her from destroying our baseboards haha, but she loves this! She will chase us around the house and look for us when we have to move around the kitchen. I'm glad she has such a wonderful way to be moving around while doing it safely. Definitely a recommended item for your baby as they get to that walking stage.
customer_reviews.author: GetFit NoExcuses

customer_reviews.title: Big but versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super sturdy and love that you can use it to feed the baby too. LO has found it easy to roll around in, and although it's big, turning around is no issue for her. DH said it is a little tricky to lock into desired height. I have not tried it so not sure if its just user error but he did say the same thing with the previous joovy we had for our first born.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great for wood floors
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Joovy walker. I have hardwood floors and my baby glides across very easy. I love the big tray. I wanted to review to let people know that this walker does not move over carpet.....at all! My baby is not able to cross over the threshold either. The walker it's self feels sturdy. I have had it for almost 2 weeks with no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tuxedo

customer_reviews.title: Buy this walker
customer_reviews.text: My 7 m/o was only sleeping 4 hours a time at night. She was spending several hours a day in one of those bouncy chairs you hang in the doorway, and I thought it was tiring her out. I got this walker and the first day I had it she was zooming around the room exploring. She slept 7 hours straight that night! 100% worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Burns

customer_reviews.title: Watch your hardwoods
customer_reviews.text: We returned this. It scratched our hardwood floor because the front wheel didn’t pivot
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Happy baby happy mama
customer_reviews.text: When I had originally opened the box the leg was out off the track I had to unscrew and put it back on track also the seat instructions say to put the front in first I found it easier to do it opposite other than that it was easy assembly. I love the removable tray so I can take that off and baby can stay and play. I wanted the grey but wasn’t going to pay more money for a color. That’s silly. I ended up with the blueberry. It’s a nice blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great walker, but just not for us and our baby.
customer_reviews.text: A lovely walker if your living space has hardwood floors and a large open floor plan, to which we have neither. It's much heavier than anticipated and there is no space between the non slip stair rails and our carpet making it impossible for our baby to walk in it. Also, I wish I would have paid more attention to the dimensions because it's very large and it doesn't fit through the awkward 90 degree turn into our kitchen. I actually wish I would have bought a much cheaper, smaller, and lighter one. Unfortunately, I think I'll be returning it because it's just not functional in our house. :(
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Baby death trap stay away
customer_reviews.text: Came with a leg out of socket out of the box and it’s impossible to put it back into socket because of the folding bracket. If I didn’t catch that and put my baby into it he would have been injured because the roller would flip on it’s side. I recommend staying away from this Product unless you want to risk your child getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew N Landis

customer_reviews.title: Our 12 month old loved this
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for him as he was stating to walk (still holding on to stuff). He loved it, would almost run and the way it works means he barely hurt himself at all in it (toddlers will always find a way to hurt themselves!). The wheels are great and very versatile and he could really pick up some speed. We bought it too late in life, he started walking and so it's now in storage already, but he enjoyed it for the few weeks / months of learning to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous. Kids can crawl out of it easily.
customer_reviews.text: Update: my son is exactly 9 months. Today we had a bad incident of him crawling out of the walker where he got onto the tray. As soon as a saw him on the tray I ran as fast as I could to catch him. This unit must have a belt to keep child from crawling out of it. Besides the product coming a little scuffed up ( why my rating is low) it’s working great! I’m seeing great results with my baby. He is actually starting to crawl and is able to have better balance.
customer_reviews.author: Svitlana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my baby boy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker when my son was 4 months old because he loved to stand. We would put a blanket under his feet so they could touch the ground. Now, my son is almost 6 month old (over 27”) tall and he is really on the go. I would say wait until your child is at least 27” to order this product since it would be challenging for them to touch the ground. Great product tho. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Mack

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing how quickly she learned to turn
customer_reviews.text: She loves it! Instantly took off on a run! Freedom to expand her world. Well designed for safety and well constructed. Much wider to navigate through doorways but consequently this broad base prevents tipping and the girth provides a perimeter of safety for toddler in the seat. It is amazing how quickly she learned to turn, backup and steer this "vehicle' around the house. IF one wheel goes over a ledge, then the walker rests on the base frame and prevents the wheels from turning. This is not to infer that you can be cavalier about stairways but this design makes it very difficult for a little toddler to move the walker without all 4 wheels free to roll.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: Love this product and the Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Our little one loves this toy so much and allows us to interact with him in daily tasks while we still get things done :D He wants to be involved and funny time doesn’t allow that, so it’s amazing to have them in this until we can be beside him for story time/ tummy time. My husband and I both work from home and absolutely love it and how it makes our little one feel. Another plus is the modern colors and we love that it doesn’t have the toys already stuck to the table top so you can put whatever toys / snacks on top without your little one becoming bored.
customer_reviews.author: monet chantel bush

customer_reviews.title: Baby's Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter when she was a little over 4 months- at first she just sat in it which is fine. I would roll her around to where I was and put toys on it for her to play with. Now she's 5 months and learning how to move around in it- plus it's perfect to use as I introduce solids to her. I've taken off the seat cover several time to clean and it was super easy. She's been able to always touch in it flat footed. I like the look of it and I bring it when we go to grandparents because it folds up so well and is easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Let your baby walk
customer_reviews.text: Great walker for your baby. My daughter started using this at the shortest setting at almost 6 months. It’s a great walker for your little one and allows them to walk around. It’s also nice that there’s a huge table area in front. Easily washable. Assembly was super easy. Remove plastics, attach seat fabric to seat area. Light to desired height. Definitely worth getting if you have room for it.
customer_reviews.author: min2be

customer_reviews.title: Joovy
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing walker!! It has protection all around for the baby's protection. The wheels are fantastic and it glides smoothly. I love that it doesn't have any big bulky toys on top. The walker has a clear, removable tray for easy clean up. I love to put toys on top of tray and he plays with his own favorite toys. It is also height adjustable which is an added plus. Chair cover is also removable and machine washable. Another great feature is that it serves as a high chair. The only con I have is that when you adjust it, it sometimes jams and can be difficult to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Wheels turn sideways and drag
customer_reviews.text: The front wheels turn sideways while going forward. They just drag and scrape across the floor while sideways, instead of rolling. Not sure if this is a defect or not. It does it when we pull it forward without baby in it and also when baby walks forward. So she can’t glide across the floor like she should be able to. Bought this based on the positive reviews and am disappointed, especially considering the price compared to other walkers. Would be a nice walker if it weren’t for the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Alex33

customer_reviews.title: Baby walker rolls easily and zero finger pinching !
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let other baby walkers with all their hanging toys fool you! This is fabulous ! It’s sturdy, well padded seat and extra large tray prevents fingers getting pinched and keeps more toys etc from hitting floor .Used for 6 month old ( shorter time at beginning), but great place to put her and give her a sense of independence . ( we live in a one story home , so did not worry about stairs )
customer_reviews.author: maryf

customer_reviews.title: Best brand for walkers worth the extra cost!
customer_reviews.text: Joovy make amazing products I have four other Products of their’s double stroller, playpen, high chairs and now the walker. This Walker is great it has an amazing turning radius so the kids can walk around easily with no problems and the wheels on it are amazing as well all other walkers have really tiny wheels in the front and they were scratching my wood floor these are great I highly recommend buying their products I’ve loved every single thing I have purchased from them and my boys are able to walk in it a lot better than any other brand and I’ve had two others.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Open tray is the best
customer_reviews.text: Loved the open tray. We have it full of all kinds of toys. We used this before she could walk and she would stand there and play with her toys around 3 1/2months. I wish it did have more of a 360 turn but she gets around great. Easy to fold down. Love the neutral color, instead of those eye sore walkers. One of the best things we have gotten her
customer_reviews.author: Ciera

customer_reviews.title: Great walker if you don't have a tall baby
customer_reviews.text: Great walker if you don't have a tall baby. My little guy was too tall for it at 7 months. He could also pull himself out of it because the long tray in front of him gave him lots of leverage.
customer_reviews.author: E. Melanson

customer_reviews.title: Seriously buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Great build, tough, perfect for eating and playing, wheels are not cheap, and has the safety feature to save my toes from my son ramming them :) I would recommend this over others. Really you don’t need toys if your child’s face as they are running around. Plus more cleaning and well now days cleaning wipes are hard to find. The tray pops off for easy wash. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Kyle Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: Love this Baby Walker!
customer_reviews.text: Our active 7 month old grand loves to play in this walker. The wide tray has a removable top piece for easy cleaning. It is also wide enough for lots of toys and keeps her fairly far away from items on tables. She can move it with a bit of effort on our Berber carpet and can easily roll on the laminate floors! Wide base makes it virtually impossible to tip over. Excellent quality. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: It’s safe
customer_reviews.text: It’s safe and has a very clean look. Has a large removable tray that the baby can have snacks or place toys on. We have couple of toys with suction that work very well. My three comments are, 1) the back two wheels don’t turn, so it’s a little hard to maneuver, 2) it’s very hard to adjust the height, and 3) the chair doesn’t go too high. I suspect my 8 month old son (82 percentile In height) will grow out of it in about two months. However, I don’t mind that too much because I feel it makes the walker safer.
customer_reviews.author: Tatev

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT walker
customer_reviews.text: We love this walker, it’s very sturdy and rolls easily. I love that I can put my sons own toys on the tray instead of this coming with its own. I love that the tray comes off for easy washing if we use it for feedings. This rolls easily and I also love that it’s big enough that he can’t really grab anything if he rolls up to something and he can’t pinch his fingers. He’ll stay in this playing longer than anything else. It was very easy and quick to assemble, the seat seems comfy and well padded. This is perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design But Arrived With A Crack
customer_reviews.text: Overall we are happy with this walker. It didn’t take long for our daughter to start zipping around the house in it. Also the large tray helps to keep her from grabbing everything in sight although she tries! The construction is lightweight and the height is easy to adjust. Our only complaint is that one of the parts the secures the legs arrived with a slight crack in it. Maybe overtightening at the factory or shipping damage. It wasn’t big enough to return but a little annoying nonetheless. Hopefully the walker continues to last and the crack is not an indication of the material quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Soekawa

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built and easy to fold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for my then 6 month old grandson; he is now 7 months old. My daughter informs me that it is very sturdy, folds easily and that my grandson easily maneuvers it all over their hard wood floors. They don't have carpeting, so I can't say how it does on that surface. The tray is large and allows her to place whatever his favorite toy of the day on it. I decided not to buy a walker with toys already affixed to the tray. Yes, this walker is a little pricey, but based on what my daughter tells me it was worth the price. So many other walkers are to cheap looking or cheaply manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Madzelan

customer_reviews.title: Came un connected on left side
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I am only giving this 4 star is because after my husband put this together, and we put our little one in...he kept leaning to his left. The walker looked crooked so we checked everything and turns out, the walker came crooked! So my husband had to unscrew to fix it. Otherwise we would have given this a 5. My 4 months old is a little over 25 inches and this walker is perfect for him! Hes very active and can sit with no assistance for short periods so this walker is helping him roam in our house.
customer_reviews.author: YX

customer_reviews.title: Best money I’ve ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best money I have ever spent, yes my 9 month old runs around ramming into everything with it but he is occupied and happy and can go explore the house. Plus he’s not crawling around on the floor picking up things he shouldn’t put in his mouth. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: The boy has leg and will travel
customer_reviews.text: This walker is wonderful. After checking all the other walkers, the pricing and features this walker was by far the best for our family. We wanted a larger tray, that way we could clean and add or remove toys for cleaning as needed. We wanted multiple levels to grow with our boy, and this walker has that. Perfect. We wanted to be able to remove the seat for cleaning and have easy set up, this walker has that also. Really, this is a win, win for those that want a clean and effective walker to grow as your baby grows. I am a fan and so is our boy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Best baby product!
customer_reviews.text: Best money spent! All those baby must have crap! This is the one! My baby absolutely loves it and follows me around. He is so cute! He sees me in the kitchen and comes over in his little walker. He is no longer constrained. Design: simple and modern. I love that it doesn't have all sorts of colors. I can add color just by adding toys. Age: I bought this for my baby around the time he was 5 months old! I think I could have used it a few weeks earlier. Now he is so entertained!
customer_reviews.author: Madina Turysbekova

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! My little guy can’t walk yet, but he loves standing in one spot in the Spoon walker and it’s his ‘play station’. There’s room for so many toys on this tray! It was easy to assemble and it’s easy to clean. It arrived with one of the legs out of its bracket, but in handy so it was no problem for me to disassemble and correct it, and then put it back together per instructions as if it were never damaged in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: ATB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walker!!
customer_reviews.text: We were not sure about this walker. But this was the best walker ever!! The food tray is just right for the baby. The tray's really large that means less mess on the floor and more in babies belly. We live in a condo and space is precious, this walker flattens out easily and goes in a closet when not in use! I noticed that some reviews mentioned that the height was really low. It is low, but not low enough for baby to tip over. Our baby was 22 inches when we bought it and it worked fabulously. Absolutely recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Really like this walker
customer_reviews.text: Really like this walker!! Love the removable tray. The fabric seat is machine washable but is very difficult to disassemble and reassemble. This walker has done a number on our floorboards. The corners are all chipped now. I also wish it had a higher setting. Our son is not very tall, but outgrew this quickly and is already trying to climb out of it at 1 year old. Other than that, we really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: I Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I Love this thing. It's not all Linds of obnoxious colors like most baby gear and isn't a huge eyesore. The tray is bigger than expected but that's a plus for me as baby hasnore room to shove food around without it going on the floor. I like that the tray pops off for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: katelen

customer_reviews.title: Great walker.
customer_reviews.text: Great little walker/scooter. If it had a higher standing height adjustment it would be a 5 star. We have two different height carpets; a plush wall to wall carpet in bedrooms and large synthetic one-half inch pile area rugs in living room. The Joovy has plastic/rubber skid plates on bottom of the frame which are attached by screws. The walker was dragging a little on 1/2 inch rug and just would not move on plush carpet even after removing the skid plates. It now rolls free on on 1/2 pile and is a real speedster on tile. Our 8 month old grand baby loves the Joovy.
customer_reviews.author: PDreader

customer_reviews.title: Super safe!
customer_reviews.text: This walker... bravo joovy! This walker moves with ease for baby. Plenty of space on the tray for snacks and toys. Fold just about flat for storage or transport. Easy to clean. Most of all, safe. I fell backwards on my son’s joovy, with him still in it. And he was not hurt even though the back end bent under my weight. The front end adjusted and the walker did not fully collapse on him. I’m grateful for the design of this walker! Therefore, I ordered a second one for my son to keep moving and jooving!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Jo Hodson

customer_reviews.title: Safety issue
customer_reviews.text: Safety issue. My son by 9 months started pulling himself out of the joovy walker by grabbing the end of tray and dragging himself out. I caught him hanging by one foot dangling. Almost fell on his head!! Also the walker is meant for really short babies because my son is in the 50 pertentile for his height and has always been too short for walker. I loved the way it looked and large tray for snacks but it’s not worth a child getting injured. For these reasons I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Great for small babies but Not for tall/long babies.
customer_reviews.text: Such clean designed. Very easy to clean. My daughter loves it. And moves it easily. My only disappointment is that it’s not for tall babies. My daughter is only 7 months and it seems too short for her. She’s been using it for a few months now and it’s height adjustable but unfortunately it stopped growing with her and she still needs the support. I’m afraid it might affect her legs and curb them.
customer_reviews.author: Mother_of_three

customer_reviews.title: Here  he comes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for my grandson who is six months old. He was getting frustrated because he wanted to keep up with other brothers and sisters. He caught on to this immediately. It moves smoothly and easily and is quite stable. It comes with a large tray and can be cleaned and be used for toys or snacks. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ricker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect I love the verstility and had many heigh adjustments wodkrd even for our 4 month old
customer_reviews.text: Our newborn rolled over at 4 days. So it was no surprise we had to get this walker at 4 months. At 6 months she has been crawling for weeks and probably will start walking by 7-8 months. This walker is great because we can put toys or food on the "table". She loves walking around but being on the short side was worried none would be at her height suprisngly this walker has many levels that fit her when she was a short 4 mint old, now that she is a bug 6 month old and proba my for many more months.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer ann Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great for kiddo, difficult for me
customer_reviews.text: Took off one star because the button on the bottom that controls the height and folding it away is SO inconvenient and difficult to use in the center on the bottom. Kiddo loves it and it seems safe! I like the large tray, I think it has helped with no injuries so far. So yes it is a large tray, but either deal with it or don’t LOL
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Good walker but had to return it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really well made walker. Kept my baby entertained for awhile so I get things done around the house. We had to return it because our pediatrician is against the use of walkers for baby’s development.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I decided to get this for my baby! He loves it!! We started using it at 4 months on the lowest setting. It works on our short carpet rug and our wood floors very well! We have a dog and both my husband and I have very very long hair and I haven't noticed the wheels getting clogged like other reviewers (we vacuum once a week). Such a sturdy walker and I love the large tray!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Heitkamp

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but best quality
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but can’t beat the removable tray. Seat a little too wide at crotch. Super safe but no wheel lock to hold him still while I feed him. Wheels do not swivel. Despite all this it is really high quality. Ours is 6 months old and I can see why people complain it’s too short. I use it every day though and think it will work long enough to get my money’s worth. Passes the picky first parents’ test.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this walker is is so chic and classy very high quality and fits my little 6 mo ds Aiden perfectly Aiden was born 19 inches long I'm a new mom so after reviewing several walkers I fell in love with the joovy spoon but I read several reviews stating if your baby was taller u would be wasting money on this walker. Well I think aidens pretty long for an infant but his feet don't touch the ground at all on the 3rd height setting of the spoon. He is 6 mo one week so I am both delighted and grateful to joovy and amazon this walker is simply beautiful and perfect!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out on this.
customer_reviews.text: I loved how sturdy it was; loved the big tray and the convenience of being able to snap the plastic lining off and clean it. However, after taking my grandson out of it, I noticed a big red welt on his thighs from rubbing on the cloth leg openings of the seat. I had it on the lowest setting and his feet touched the ground...but it looked like it chafed him. Openings too tight and small?
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love the stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love the stroller. Even works great on an unevem slate floor. Our house has a step down, we thought we would have to purchase a gate to closed of the area but once the front wheel go over the edge, it get stuck, you would need to lift it off. It can never fall offf the edge due to only having wheels in the front and back. The frame stops it from going over. Im happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: KAREN

product_meta.title: Joovy Spoon Walker, Adjustable Baby Walker, Activity Center, Greenie
product_meta.description: Color:GreenieWalker meets highchair. The spoon walker combines these two essential products into one to provide the perfect balance of eating, playing and learning to walk. Practical and good looking, the spoon will blend perfectly into your kitchen and home decor. For meal and snack time, the spoon comes with a super sized tray that has a removable insert that can be wiped clean or put in the dishwasher for convenience. Once mealtime is over, there is lots of room for play. The extra large tray has plenty of room for all your child's favorite toys. The bright white color and high gloss finish give the spoon premium styling that cleans up easily. As your child learns to master walking, you will feel confident using the spoon with its ultra wide base that provides unparalleled strength, stability, mobility and safety. The wide base ensures that little fingers won't get pinched on the side of the tray if your toddler bumps into a wall. The seat pad is supportive and comfortable, machine washable, and is made with 600D material combining luggage grade toughness with a soft and padded high seat back.Features: Padded Seat, adjustable height, folds for easy transport and storage, Snack Tray, Break Pads.
feature_bullets: Super sized tray with removable insert, insert is dishwasher safe
Wide base ensures that little fingers won't get pressed. Maximum child height: 33.5 inches. Maximum child weight: 30 pounds
Seat pad is supportive and comfortable, machine washable
Three height positions, oversized wheels and non slip stair pads.Open size: 18 x 25.5 x 27.75 inches ,Folded size: 9 x 25.5 x 27.75 inches
Folds flat for easy storage and travel; BPA, PVC and Phthalate free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,418 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
